result.execSummary:
The defendant Carvester Carver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety, random urine screens. Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA, and Victim/Witness surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide DNA Sample and pay costs. CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carvester Carver

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carvester Carver in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BR. 26.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   

The court sentenced the defendant to 9 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 daystime served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 14 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Perform 40 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA, and Victim/Witness surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample and pay costs.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
On behalf of the defendant; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-FORWARDED TO BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 26 FOR SENTENCING.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Carvester Carver in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Paul Hauer for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carvester Carver in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-16-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carvester Carver in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it.
The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Carvester Carver in court.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. cmt  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
14RM018895  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04-05-2014
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-8-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
